body:
<!-- Please only use this template for submitting reports about failing tests in Kubernetes CI jobs -->

**Which jobs are failing**: soak-gce-gci-1.13, others

**Which test(s) are failing**: [sig-scheduling] SchedulerPredicates [Serial] validates MaxPods limit number of pods that are allowed to run [Slow]

**Since when has it been failing**:

Rougly forever.  #63768 shows how this test was flaking back during the 1.11 cycle.  There's been no sudden increase in frequency, but a test that flakes roughly 1.5 times per hour needs looking into, and probably tweaking.

**Testgrid link**:

https://k8s-testgrid.appspot.com/sig-release-1.13-all#soak-gci-gce-1.13
https://gubernator.k8s.io/build/kubernetes-jenkins/logs/ci-kubernetes-soak-gci-gce-beta/500

**Reason for failure**:

Most of the time, these flakes are timeouts.  However, sometimes they have other causes; see Triage link: https://storage.googleapis.com/k8s-gubernator/triage/index.html?date=2018-10-15&test=validates%20MaxPods%20limit%20number%20of%20pods%20that%20are%20allowed%20to%20run

**Anything else we need to know**:

This is part of a general effort to clean up our CI signal by eliminating longstanding, frequent flakes.

<!-- DO NOT EDIT BELOW THIS LINE -->
/kind flake
/priority important-longterm
/sig scheduling
attn:
@kubernetes/sig-scheduling-bugs 
@k82cn

title: Flake: [sig-scheduling] SchedulerPredicates [Serial] validates MaxPods limit number of pods that are allowed to run [Slow]
